channel.title: [Project Insanity]Donation Currency[Project Insanity]
channel.description:
how would make a new form of "currency" only available to donors or players of my choice. i know i have to make a new token for the currency but my main goal is how do i change the currency for [b]1[/b] shop only.
help would be appreciated great

item.title: [Project Insanity]Donation Currency[Project Insanity]
item.dc:creator: @RealmofTerror RealmofTerror
item.description:
@RealmofTerror wrote:

To answer the first part of your question, the most common way to code donor ONLY currency would be:

If (hasItem(<donorcurrencyIDhere>, <Amount>)) { If (<donorvariableortitlehere> == 1) { Put nothing here. That means it simply does not remove the currency for donors. The "Else" statement below says to remove it from people that AREN'T donors. } else { Code to remove items here (I can't recall exactly how) } }

Hope this helped?

That just removes the currency from non donors, plus wouldn’t it be more efficient to loop the command instead of using an if-then statement, you could use a when statement and it would constantly check for non donors with donor currency.

Read full topic

To answer the first part of your question, the most common way to code donor ONLY currency would be:

If (hasItem(<donorcurrencyIDhere>, <Amount>)) { If (<donorvariableortitlehere> == 1) { Put nothing here. That means it simply does not remove the currency for donors. The "Else" statement below says to remove it from people that AREN'T donors. } else { Code to remove items here (I can't recall exactly how) } }

Hope this helped?

item.title: [Project Insanity]Donation Currency[Project Insanity]
item.dc:creator: @RealmofTerror RealmofTerror
item.description:
@RealmofTerror wrote:

You change how many points it cost the same way you change the price for any other item. Since you edited the shop to take a different kind of currency what ever number you put in for the price will be out of the set currency.

Example: set currency is 995 (Coins) you set the price to 100k, the shop takes 100k 995 (coins)
Set currency is 6529 (Tokkul) you set the price to 100k, the shop takes 100k of 6529 (Tokkul)

The number is not specific to coins just to what currency was set for that shop. Hope I helped =)

Read full topic
